title: property
comment: The ultimate source of all property is God. While property is entrusted to human beings, they have responsibilities towards God as a result of their stewardship.

children.title: property, nature of
children.comment: Possessions are a gift from God to be used for his glory, for human pleasure and in benefiting others.

children.title: Possessions are a cause for thanksgiving
Owning possessions is open to abuse
They can cause pride and forgetfulness
Abuse of ownership leads to judgment
It is to be used to help others
It is to be used to assist strangers
Laws governing the inheritance of property
property, land
children.comment: All land belongs to God, and he allows people to care for it and use it for their own needs and the needs of others. The land promised to Israel is a special case illustrating the spiritual inheritance of all believers and God's ultimate purpose for the world.

children.title: It is in his possession and care
It is given to human beings to manage

primaryrefs.comment: All exploitation of land is therefore contrary to God's purpose.

secondaryrefs.comment: Jeremiah's purchase was an act of faith.
Land boundaries were marked out by stones, the removal of which was a serious offence

children.title: God's ultimate purpose for the world
property, houses
children.comment: From at least the time of the flood people have built houses to live in and these have been a major part of their property; the temple was seen as God's house.

children.title: Houses are a major part of people's property
It was a place to meet God
It is a picture of the church
